org.jcvi.jillion.internal.core.util

Class GrowableBitArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.internal.core.util.GrowableBitArray

  • public final class GrowableBitArray
extends Object
    A GrowableBitArray is a utility class that wraps an array that will dynamically grow as needed when data is appended, inserted, replaced and removed etc. This is similar to an ArrayList or StringBuilder for primitive bits. This class is not Thread-safe.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GrowableBitArray(boolean[] bytes)
      Creates a new GrowableBitArray where the backing byte array is an exact copy of the input array and the initial capacity is set to the array length.

      Creates a new GrowableBitArray with the given initial capacity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GrowableBitArray

        public GrowableBitArray(int initialCapacity)
        Creates a new GrowableBitArray with the given initial capacity.
        Parameters:
        initialCapacity - the initial size of the backing byte array. When adding bytes will cause the byte array to overflow, the backing byte array will automatically grow larger.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if initialCapacity is <=0.

      • GrowableBitArray

        public GrowableBitArray(boolean[] bytes)
        Creates a new GrowableBitArray where the backing byte array is an exact copy of the input array and the initial capacity is set to the array length. This has similar (although optimized) functionality to 
         byte[] bytes = ...
 GrowableBitArray gba = new GrowableBitArray(bytes.length);
 gba.append(bytes);
        Parameters:
        bytes - the initial byte values to set to the backing array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bytes is null.

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public GrowableBitArray copy()
        Create a new instance of GrowableBitArray that is an exact copy of this instance. Any future modifications to either the original instance or the copy will NOT be reflected in the other.
        Returns:
        a new instance of GrowableBitArray that contains the same data as this instance currently does.
